moves.1. d4 d5 2. c4 dxc4 3. Nf3 Nf6 4. e3 b5: The bishop move led me to move my rook where I need it anyway.
moves.33. Rd2d3: I am on my way to take his queen, that is if he doesn't see what I am doing....
moves.33... a4: The pawn move shows, I have little time.
moves.34. Ng5: Sacrifice the knight to get pawns out of my way.
moves.34... hxg5: He shouldn't have taken the bait.
moves.35. hxg5: My pawn out of the way too.
moves.36. Qh2: Now move queen to h4, no wait h2 is better.  It looks like I am worried about my kings castle.
moves.36... f6: Taking the pawn might have worked as well or better, however the pawn to g6 is more beautiful and I will get his queen for sure, or so I think.
moves.37. g6: Mate in 3, even though I thought I was gonna get a free queen.
moves.37... Ree8: This rook move is no better than any at this point.
moves.38. Qh7+: The pawn covers my queen and the otherwise safe place for his king cause he would still protect his g7 pawn.
moves.39... Ke7: Only move here also because of my kindly yet stern pawn.
moves.40. Qxg7#: Here, I expected to get his queen, however... Lo and behold... It's mate.
